answers.answer: No, actually it doesn't sound like much of anything at all, other than progressively increasing anxiety.  I'm glad you're seeing a neurologist, who is best able to put to rest any concerns about strange underlying diseases, which I can't even imagine your having.  Once you get a clean bill of neurological health, as I believe you will, I suggest you forget about it, and if you can't that you be treated for the anxiety which I think is developing into a vicious circle.  Sometimes peoplke itch in one spot for no particular reason.  It's best to treat the itch--over-the-counter Caladryl or Sarna--and then just let the matter take care of itself.Good luck.Dr. Rockoff

question: Hi Doctor,I went to Six Flags on August 17th and it was a very hot day, ever Since August 17th I’ve been having severe itching in my right palm only in the area underneath my thumb towards the middle of my palm. I went to a dermatologist and she suggested that it was a blocked sweat gland and stated that it would resolve in a few days. A week later the itch got worse, there was what seemed to be a blocked gland under my skin so she took a needle and “removed” the small tiny bump under my skin, the itching continued. It seems as though every time I feel the itch, my vein turns into a circular dark patch and goes away when the itching subsides. I’ve used steroid creams and hydrocortisone creams with no relief. She than suggested that it could be liver related, ran a liver function and hepatitis test (all normal). She now thinks its nerve related and I could’ve damaged a nerve but it’s been almost three months now and the itching continues. This has really taken a toll on my life, stressing me out a lot. I’ve had a CBC, liver panel, and test for HIV and STD’s, x-ray of the hand and everything is negative/normal. What could this possibly be and how do I get rid of it? I have an appointment with the neurologist this Thursday hoping for answers. I’m afraid this is something serious, but the rest of my body doesn’t itch, only that one spot. Also I want to add that my hands aren’t dry and I always moisturize with Avenno lotion. Do you have any idea what this could be??? In your medical expertise, does it sound like a symptom of an underlying disease or something serious??? Thank You.
title: Continous Palmar Itch...PLEASE HELP!
